title: Minimum Number of Arrows to Burst Balloons
description: There are some spherical balloons taped onto a flat wall that represents the XY-plane. The balloons are represented as a 2D integer array points where points[i] = [xstart, xend] denotes a balloon whose horizontal diameter stretches between xstart and xend. An arrow can be shot up vertically (in the positive y-direction) from different points along the x-axis. A balloon with xstart and xend is burst by an arrow shot at x if xstart <= x <= xend. There is no limit to the number of arrows that can be shot. A single arrow shot at some x can burst all balloons that include x in their range. Given the array points, return the minimum number of arrows that must be shot to burst all balloons.
input_format: The first line contains the number of balloons n. Each of the following n lines contains two space-separated integers xstart and xend.
